hints.content: Start by understanding the input format. You are given an array of strings. Each string can be considered as a segment that will be concatenated together. Think about how you can concatenate these strings effectively.

Consider how you would concatenate the strings in the array. You might want to explore using a loop or a built-in function to join the strings together. For example, in Python, you can use `''.join(array)`.

Once you have the concatenated string, think about how to split it back into segments. The problem requires you to split the concatenated string into its original components. Consider what criteria you would use for splitting.

Remember that the order of the strings matters. When you split the concatenated string, you need to ensure that you can reconstruct the original order of the strings. What data structure could help you maintain this order?
Think about edge cases. What happens if the input array contains only one string? How would you handle that? Make sure your solution accounts for this scenario.
Consider how to handle cases where the concatenated string could have multiple valid splits. You might need to think about how to choose the correct split if there are multiple options.
You should also think about the constraints of the problem. Are there any limits on the length of the strings or the number of strings in the array? This could affect your approach.
As you work towards a solution, remember to think about the return format. What should your function return? Make sure you are clear on the expected output type.
When implementing your solution, consider using a helper function to manage the splitting logic. This can help keep your code organized and easier to debug.

Finally, think about how to implement the logic to find the split points. You might want to iterate through the concatenated string and check for matches with the original strings. This will be the core of your solution.

questionNotes: Input is an array of strings that will be concatenated.
The order of strings in the array is important for reconstruction.
Consider edge cases, especially when the input array has only one string.
Be aware of potential multiple valid splits and how to handle them.
Clarify the expected return format for your solution.
